data.name: robotic vacuum
data.description:
We have a very lazy robot vacuum cleaner.

When activated, it searches for the stain closest to its position and moves towards it to eliminate it. In case there are two equidistant places, choose the one that is closer to the top wall (smaller row) and then to the left wall (smaller column).

The vacuum cleaner can move diagonally and horizontally.

The room you have to clean can be considered rectangular.

You must calculate and return the distance the vacuum cleaner travels to clean each stain and return to the original position.

The input data is an array of characters where the X symbolizes the origin of the vacuum cleaner and each * a stain to be cleaned.

It can be considered that there is only one point of origin and at least one stain to be cleaned.

Efficiency is mandatory, there is a solution in O(n^3) but there is one in O(log n *n^2).
The solution has a 0.01 margin to be accepted.

For example:

```
x   *
    *
    * 
```    
clean (0,2) = + 2 moves

```
x    
    *
    * 
```     
clean (1,2) = + 1 moves

```
x    
     
    * 
```    
clean (1,3) = + 1 moves

```
x    
     
       
```       
return to base (0,0) = + 2.82 moves

total = 2 + 1 + 1 +2.82 = 6.82 movements
